Get Started

Schedule a Free 15-Minute Phone Consultation

Learn more about our practice and how we can be of help to you and your family.

Contact

Get Started

Schedule a Free 15-Minute Phone Consultation

Learn more about our practice and how we can be of help to you and your family.

Sarah Lambert​

Client Care Coordinator

Free, No-Obligation Consultation

Connect with our Client Care Coordinator, Sarah Lambert​. She will happily answer your questions and help match you with the best therapist for your needs.

3 Ways to Connect With Us

Call Us | 678-249-0072

Email Us | clientcare@eccfcounseling.com

Use The Appointment Calendar Below

Appointment Calendar

Frequently Asked Questions

Ups and downs happen in every family. If you feel your family is stuck in conflict though or you are concerned whether what your child or teen is experiencing is typical, counseling can help. Don’t worry if you aren’t sure or still have questions though. We offer a free, no-obligation 15-minute consultation call with our Client Care Coordinator.

Our therapists start with an initial session for just parents to discuss concerns and set goals for counseling. Treatment is typically a mix of individual sessions for the child teen, family sessions as needed, and parent sessions for strategies. The length of treatment can vary, and you and your child’s therapist will work together to determine the best plan for your family.

Sessions are typically 50 minutes in length with fees ranging from $150 to $190 per session, depending on the therapist you see.

For small group counseling, sessions are typically 45 minutes with fees ranging from $50 to $75 per session, depending on the group. Groups meet for a set number of weekly sessions, usually 8 to 10 weeks.

Current clients receive the following services as part of their session fee:

Individualized treatment plans that are updated as needed.

Occasional brief phone conversations with your therapist for updates and questions outside of sessions.

At your request, brief phone communication between your therapist and other professionals caring for your child (doctor, psychiatrist, teacher, school counselor, psychiatrist, occupational therapists, speech pathologists, etc.)

At your request, letters to other professionals caring for your child regarding treatment goals and progress.

Resources to support your family’s goals and progress.

Referral information for other professionals who can support your family’s goals and progress.

Below are the service codes used most often. If you call your insurance company, you can ask what they reimburse for these specific services.

90834 Psychotherapy (50 min) | individual sessions

90846 Family Psychotherapy without patient present (50 min) | parent sessions for brainstorming strategies, updates, feedback

90847 Family Psychotherapy, conjoint with patient present (50 min) | family sessions

90853 Group Therapy (45 min) | small group sessions

Early Connections Child & Family Counseling is an out-of-network provider. Many insurance companies will offer partial reimbursement of fees through your out-of-network benefits, and we are happy to provide you with an insurance-friendly receipt for this. You are also welcome to use a Health Savings Account or Flex Spending Account for your payment at the time of service.

If you plan to use insurance, we always recommend calling your insurance company to confirm your benefits and the process for reimbursement.

Questions to Ask Your Insurance Company:

What are my “out-of-network” outpatient mental health insurance benefits?

What is my deductible and have I met it?

Are there any limitations on how many services will be covered annually?

Is it possible to meet with a provider that I choose?

What is the process for submitting receipts for reimbursement?

What is the coverage amount per therapy session? Does this change if we choose an associate-licensed therapist?

How long will it take to get my reimbursement?

Do I need a referral from a primary care physician?

Are virtual outpatient mental health visits (or teletherapy) covered by my plan?

As an out-of-network provider, Early Connections has partnered with Mentaya to help families save money on therapy.

Use this tool below to see if you qualify for reimbursement for therapy services.

Convenient Location, calming Grounds

Directions to Our Office

ROSWELL OFFICE

Heading west on Highway 92: Go past Target, Wildwood Office Park is on the right just after Laurel Lake subdivision. If you get to the red light at Mabry, you have gone too far.

Heading east on Highway 92: Go past Movie Tavern, you will make a U-turn at Laurel Lake Drive and Wildwood Office Park will be your next right.

Once in the office park, take your first right. Follow the bend and Building 300 will be on your left. Come in through the middle double doors.

ATLANTA / POWERS FERRY OFFICE

From I-285 West / GA-400: From GA-400, take exit for I-285 West toward Chattanooga/Birmingham. Take Exit 22 for Northside Drive toward New Northside Drive / Powers Ferry Road. Use right two lanes to turn right onto New Northside Drive. Turn right into RiverEdge One Office Park. Free Visitor parking available. Once in main lobby, take elevators to 4th floor. Our office entry will be on your left.

From I-75 / I-285 East: From I-75 North or South, take exit for I-285 East towards Greenville/Augusta. Once on I-285 East, take Exit 22 for Northside Drive toward New Northside Drive / Powers Ferry Road. Turn left onto New Northside Drive. Turn right into RiverEdge One Office Park. Free Visitor parking available. Once in main lobby, take elevators to 4th floor. Our office entry will be on your left.

We can help.

We'll See You Soon
